description: A chronic autoimmune disease that affects multiple organ systems.
causes: Unknown; possible genetic and environmental factors.
treatments: Medications, including corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, and antimalarials; physical therapy and lifestyle changes.
description: An autoimmune disease characterized by joint inflammation, often accompanied by fever and rash.
treatments: Medications, including corticosteroids, NSAIDs, and disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs; physical therapy.
description: A systemic inflammatory disease characterized by high fever, rash, and joint pain.
treatments: Corticosteroids, NSAIDs, and immunomodulating medications.
description: A rare disease in children that involves inflammation of blood vessels throughout the body.
treatments: High-dose intravenous immunoglobulin and aspirin.
description: A viral infection spread by mosquitoes that causes a high fever and severe muscle, joint, and headache pain.
causes: Dengue virus infection from the bite of infected mosquitoes.
treatments: Supportive care, including fluids, rest, and fever-reducing medications; no specific antiviral treatment available.
description: A viral infection spread by mosquitoes that causes fever and severe joint pain.
causes: Chikungunya virus infection from the bite of infected mosquitoes.
treatments: Supportive care, including pain relief and rest.
description: A highly contagious viral illness that causes a distinctive rash, fever, cough, and other symptoms.
causes: Measles virus infection spread through respiratory droplets and direct contact.
treatments: No specific treatment available; supportive care, including rest and hydration.
description: A complication of untreated strep throat that causes inflammation of heart, joints, brain, and skin.
causes: Autoimmune response triggered by untreated Streptococcus pyogenes (group A strep) infection.
treatments: Antibiotics to eradicate strep bacteria and anti-inflammatory medications to treat symptoms.
description: A bacterial infection spread by ticks that causes fever, headache, and a characteristic rash.
causes: Rickettsia rickettsii infection from the bite of infected ticks.
description: A viral infection that affects the liver and can cause chronic liver disease.
causes: Hepatitis C virus infection spread through contact with infected blood or bodily fluids.

prognosis: Varies depending on disease severity and response to treatment; with early treatment, most people achieve cure and no long-term liver damage.

description: A stroke is a medical emergency that occurs when the blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced, depriving brain tissue of oxygen and nutrients. Brain cells can die within minutes, leading to permanent damage and loss of function.

description: Multiple sclerosis is an autoimmune disease that affects the central nervous system, disrupting the flow of information between the brain and the body. In MS, the immune system attacks the myelin sheath, the protective covering that surrounds nerve fibers.

description: A brain tumor is an abnormal mass of tissue that grows in the brain. Brain tumors can be benign (non-cancerous) or malignant (cancerous). Malignant brain tumors can invade and destroy nearby brain tissue.

description: A transient ischemic attack (TIA), sometimes called a mini-stroke, is a temporary disruption of blood flow to part of the brain. Symptoms are typically similar to those of a stroke but resolve within minutes. However, TIAs are a warning sign that a stroke may occur in the future.

description: Guillain-Barré syndrome is a rare autoimmune disorder in which the immune system attacks the peripheral nerves, causing muscle weakness, numbness, and tingling. In severe cases, it can lead to paralysis and respiratory failure.

description: Cervical spondylosis is a condition that affects the bones, discs, and ligaments in the neck. It can cause pain, stiffness, and numbness in the neck, shoulders, and arms. In some cases, it can also compress the spinal cord, leading to weakness and difficulty walking.

description: Migraine with aura is a type of migraine headache that is preceded by neurological symptoms known as an aura. Auras typically involve visual disturbances, such as flashes of light or zig-zag lines, but can also include other symptoms like tingling, numbness, or speech difficulties.

description: Vitamin B12 deficiency is a condition that occurs when the body does not have enough vitamin B12. Vitamin B12 is essential for the production of red blood cells and the maintenance of the nervous system. Deficiency can cause a variety of neurological symptoms, including weakness, numbness, and difficulty walking.

description: Lyme disease is an infectious disease caused by a type of bacteria called Borrelia burgdorferi. It is transmitted to humans through the bite of an infected tick. Lyme disease can cause a variety of symptoms, including fever, headache, fatigue, and muscle aches. In some cases, it can also affect the nervous system, causing weakness, numbness, and difficulty walking.

description: Bells palsy is a condition that causes temporary weakness or paralysis of the facial muscles. It is typically caused by damage to the facial nerve, which controls the muscles of the face. Bells palsy can cause drooping of the face, difficulty closing the eye, and drooling.
Autoimmune disease (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis)
mixed connective tissue disease with features of both lupus and rheumatoid arthritis
